participant_1.name: Emily
participant_1.personality: Active, social, and prideful about her achievements. She enjoys the outdoors and values family and friendships.
participant_1.background: I like to enjoy some comfort food like spaghetti and meatballs when I'm not counting calories. I have won an Olympic medal. I like to stay active and learn new things in my free time. I take pride in my appearance. I love the Fourth of July because it's a day to celebrate our country and spend time with friends and family.

participant_2.name: Jake
participant_2.personality: Laid-back and carefree, he embraces his quirks and values personal happiness. He is committed to being a good parent.
participant_2.background: I decided to move to Salt Lake City to be with my girlfriend. I am a person who is happy with my hobbies and I am not too concerned about what others think of me. I'm a bit of a klutz but I'm comfortable with who I am and I'll do everything I can to give my child a good future. I want to learn how to play the guitar so I can perform my favorite pop songs in front of my friends. I'm going to see my brother this weekend to take my mind off my wife.

content.text: I'm doing well! I just moved to Salt Lake City to be with my girlfriend.
Oh cool! I've heard good things about Salt Lake City. What do you like most about it so far?
I like the hiking trails and the mountains. I'm also excited to explore the city more.
Nice! I love hiking too. I'm not sure if you've heard of it, but there's a great trail called the Bonneville Shoreline Trail that goes along the Great Salt Lake. It's a really beautiful hike.
Oh that sounds awesome! I'll have to check it out.
Yeah, it's definitely worth it. Do you have any other hobbies besides hiking?
I also like to play guitar. I'm not very good at it, but I enjoy it.
That's great! I used to play guitar, but I haven't in a while. I should pick it back up.
You should! It's a lot of fun.
I might just do that. Thanks for the suggestion.
She's great! She's really smart and funny. We have a lot in common.
That's awesome! I'm glad you're happy.
